about_the_game:
"After falling asleep on the last train, I woke up in a bizarre place called Saihate Station..."

An exploration/horror/adventure game about the codependent, love-hate relationship between two men.

The main characters Haru Akinashi and Shion Tatsunami are both 26 years old and work in the same company.

Since Haru joined the company two months earlier, Shion calls him "Senpai."

They are complete opposites: Shion is cheerful and adept at everything, while Haru is a slow worker who lacks confidence.

Feeling inferior, and even a little envious, Haru starts to distance himself from Shion.

But a twist of fate brings both of them to Saihate Station, where they make a promise to work together and return home.

Their interactions are awkward at first, given the estrangement, but with each problem they overcome together, Haru recalls their former friendship, and their bond grows stronger than before.

Then, the whole truth of Saihate Station is revealed.

What will become of their feelings? And what are their destinations?

Character introduction

● Haru Akinashi

A self-effacing office worker who lacks confidence and social skills.

He processes things slowly and is often reprimanded by his manager.

Because he joined the company two months earlier, he's told to behave like a senior to Shion.

The two get along well, being the same age, but Haru starts to distance himself from Shion due to feelings of inferiority and even envy.

● Shion Tatsunami

An office worker at the same company as Haru, whom he calls "Senpai."

He appears to be talented, cheerful and kind, but the truth is...

Game features

Multiple endings

Your actions will affect Haru's dependency level, which determines how the story unfolds.

Low difficulty

The game features only simple puzzles and chase scenes, with no surprise elements. Even if you encounter a game over, you can continue right away without needing to load a save.

 Focus on dialogue

You can enjoy the interactions of two completely different characters.

Warning

This work contains depictions of physical and verbal abuse, blood, unsettling sound effects, vomiting, murder, justification of criminal acts, and ambiguous ethics. It may be unsuitable for players who have difficulties distinguishing fiction and reality, who are dealing with mental health issues, or who are susceptible to over-stimulation.
